dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Occurs mainly in the shallow and weedy parts of brooks, small streams and swamps in the rainforest (Ref. 3788).  Not a seasonal killifish (Ref. 27139).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.title: Range Description
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Moelants, T. 2010. Epiplatys duboisi. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description: Aphyoplatys duboisi is known from Pool Malebo (Stanley Pool) and from the systems of the lower Kasai and Central Congo Rivers. It is also known from the drainage systems of the Nkéni, Alima, Vouma, Kouyou and Likouala Rivers in eastern Congo.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Africa:  systems of the lower Kasai and Middle Congo Rivers in western Democratic Republic of the Congo.  The drainage systems of the Nkéni, Alima, Vouma, Kouyou and Likouala rivers in eastern Congo.
dataObjects.references: Wildekamp, R.H., R. Romand and J.J. Scheel 1986 Cyprinodontidae. p. 165-276. In J. Daget, J.-P. Gosse and D.F.E. Thys van den Audenaerde (eds.) Check-list of the freshwater fishes of Africa (CLOFFA). ISNB, Brussels, MRAC; Tervuren; and ORSTOM, Paris. Vol. 2. (Ref. 3788)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Habitat
dataObjects.title: Habitat and Ecology
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Moelants, T. 2010. Epiplatys duboisi. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Habitat and Ecology
Aphyoplatys duboisi is a benthopelagic, non-migratory species that occurs mainly in the shallow and weedy parts of brooks, small streams and swamps in the rainforest (Wildekamp et al. 1986). It is not a seasonal killifish (Huber 1996).

Systems
  • Freshwater

Contributor/s

Justification
The species is widespread or without major threats throughout the Central Africa assessment region and is assessed as Least Concern.
